result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry E George was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs due in 90 days. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25.00

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in person. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court renders sentence of $300 fine plus costs due in 90 days.
Sentencing hearing on June 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Henry E George in court.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of attorney form filed. Court examines defendant and accepts said waiver. Defendant enters no contest plea. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant and accepts plea. Court finds defendant guilty.  Court sets matter over for sentencing to allow defendant to obtain assessment for anger management.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel waives reading and advises the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $150 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $150 signature bond w/condition:  no violent contact with A.G. or any other member of the family.  Court orders matter adj to 3/4 at 8:15 am for plea hearing.  Defendant advises will not be retaining counsel.
